title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Thursday, 10 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: a report into a fatal crash involving a hertfordshire pilot at the shoreham air show has found organisers failed to carry out a proper risk assessment .
a 17-year-old boy has been arrested in high wycombe this morning on sus of terror offences .
the mother of a four-year-old in luton speaks of shock at de-radicalisation plan suggestion after he drew a cucumber .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our coverage throughout the day
text: that 's all from the local live team today .
we 'll be back to bring you more news , sport , weather and travel tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: nadine dorries claimed for second home despite promises not to
text: details of mps expenses released today show conservative mp for mid-bedfordshire claimed £ 1,800 a month , thought to be for rent on her london flat .
that 's despite nadine dorries saying , in june 2013 , she would no longer claim personal expenses and would use her salary to fund her second home in westminster .
`` i have removed myself from the expenses system , '' she wrote on her blog .
but details released today show she claimed the money between august and november 2015 .
according to her latest register of financial interests , she is also receiving £ 11,000 a month from her publisher .
author: Paul Scoins
BBC Three Counties Radio political reporter

documents.title: st albans cannabis factory raided
text: a cannabis factory in st albans has been raided by police after neighbours raised sus
officers forced entry into the property in antoine gate at 10:00 where they found three bedrooms full of about 100 plants .
police believe the drugs would have been worth £ 50,000 .
they will remain at the scene until evening .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: luton brothel closed by police
text: police in luton have closed down a brothel at a house in grampian way .
the property now has a closure notice in place .
it was part of an operation started in march to tackle anti-social behaviour .
thirty-four sex workers were spoken to and moved on in the first week .
more than 30 letters have been sent to people believed to be kerb crawlers .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : chance of frost tonight
text: tonight : staying dry with the chance of a frost .
some mist and fog patches developing towards the end of the night .
lows of -1c ( 30f ) .
tomorrow : a chilly start with a touch of frost .
mist and fog patches lifting to bring another dry day with sunny spells and patchy cloud .
highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: school report : bucks newsroom timelapse
text: buckinghamshire pupils have been working hard towards their deadline on today 's bbc school report news day , the 10th annual event .
pupils at john hampden grammar school in high wycombe looked at a range of to including health , politics and employment , before putting together reports and scripts .
the above video shows their newsroom throughout the day .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: latest headlines : shoreham air crash report luton brothel closed
text: the headlines :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man wanted to go to jail so set fire to police station bin
text: a court has heard how a man deliberately started a fire outside the police station in bedford because he wanted to be arrested .
nicholas quinn , 32 , of no fixed address , did n't think he would be able to quit his drug addiction outside of prison .
mr quinn set fire to a rubbish bin outside greyfriars police station , told officers what he 'd done and waited to be arrested .
he came off drugs while in jail awaiting today 's hearing .
the judge sentenced him to six months , the equivalent of time served .
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: dead puppy dumping ground in hertfordshire
text: the rspca is investigating after a dumping ground for dead puppies was found along a country lane in hertfordshire .
officers were alerted to the puppies along hogg end lane in st albans on 27 february , where nine bodies were found - all thought to be terriers and collie-types between six and eight-weeks-old .
the charity believe the site may be used on a regular basis by some sort of puppy farm as the remains of three other dogs and bones were also found .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school report : reporting on junior doctors strike
text: school pupils at st margaret 's school in bushey have been reporting on the junior doctors ' strike as part of their bbc school report .
this year 's news day marks 10 years of bbc school report , with more than 400,000 school reporters having taken part over the project 's first nine years .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: watch 3cr presenter 's reaction to studio trip
text: if you need a quick afternoon and coffee 's not doing the trick , then how about this
presenter jonathan vernon-smith reacting to newsreader simon oxley 's exit from the studio this morning .
our news reader simon oxley has a senior moment during today 's @ twitterid # fail
@ bbc3cr @ twitterid if you look at the window when simon falls , you can see his reflection as he falls !
lol
@ twitterid @ twitterid i love how you can just see a tiny bit of his fall in the reflection on the window
@ twitterid @ twitterid poor simon lol
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: world 's biggest aircraft almost complete
text: the world 's biggest aircraft is almost complete and ready to begin test flights over bedfordshire after a fin and engine were attached to the hull .
the airlander 10 is a cross between an airship , a plane and a helicopter .
it is as long as a football pitch and as tall as six double decker buses , and is housed in one of the cardington sheds from where it will make its maiden voyage .
a crane helped guide the 11 by nine metre fin into place and the engine was hoisted into position before being fixed with five carbon composite battens .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: blind teen from watford 'would n't have bionic eyes '
text: a blind teenager from watford says he would n't have bionic eyes , even if they were an option to him , because he does n't need vision to lead a fulfilling life .
kelsey , who goes to watford grammar , is completely blind with two artificial eyes .
he 's shared his story for bbc school report .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: hitchin museum will open in may
text: hitchin town hall will open in may , it was decided at a public meeting held last night .
the building has been closed for years for redevelopment and the construction of a new museum .
protesters say the delays have cost more than £ 1m .
jackie mcdonald , who 's behind `` the future of hitchin town hall & museum '' facebook group , says she is pleased with the news adding that discussions are under way to keep costs down .

documents.title: weather watchers : stony stratford flooding
text: flood water in buckinghamshire and north bedfordshire still has n't subsided in some areas .
weather watcher `` ousewatch '' has sent us this photograph of the scene in stony stratford this afternoon .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: school report : tips from bbc newsreader
text: students in harpenden have been receiving some hints and tips about journalism from a bbc newsreader as part of school report day .
martine croxall , newsreader for bbc news 24 , has been speaking to pupils at sir john lawes school .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: afternoon headlines : shoreham crash report wycombe terror arrest
text: the stories we 're looking at this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton mum 'baffled ' by counter terror referral
text: a luton mum says she was left `` baffled '' by worries of nursery staff about her four-year-old son 's drawings , which they wanted to refer to counter terrorism services .
the nursery said the case was n't referred to channel , a de-radicalisation programme , but was referred to a panel made up of police and social services .
it decided there was no need for further action .
since last july , teachers and public service workers have a legal obligation to report any concerns of extremist behaviour to the authorities .
just under 2,000 under 15s were referred between january 2012 and december 2015 .
hear the full report at 17:00 here .
author: BBC Radio's Asian Network

documents.title: school report in beds , herts and bucks
text: news school report 's 10th annual news day is under way , with about 30,000 students in schools across the uk making and broadcasting the news .

school reporters across bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire are taking part by going on air and writing stories for online , including these students from sir william borlase 's grammar school in bucks .
we 'll bring you more throughout the day .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man ordered to court over five-year-old 's road death
text: a man has been summoned to court over a fatal collision in milton keynes last year in which a five-year-old boy was killed .
riley ferguson died in hospital four days after the collision in woodspring court , monkston last june .
a 41-year-old from the town has been ordered to attend milton keynes magistrates ' court next month in connection with causing death by careless driving .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shoreham pilot due to be interviewed again
text: hertfordshire pilot andy hill , who was flying the hawker hunter jet which crashed on to the a27 during a display at the shoreham air show last august , is due to be interviewed again , police have said .
an interim report into the crash , which left 11 people dead , has revealed a catalogue of missed opportunities to prevent the accident .
the findings from the air accident investigation branch have also criticised the event 's `` inadequate '' risk management procedure .
sussex police says its investigation is ongoing and mr hill , from sandon , will be interviewed again `` in due course '' .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: weather : cloud clearing with sunny spells later
text: this afternoon : a cloudy start with the odd spot of rain .
it will brighten up during the next couple of hours , with sunny spells in places .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: mps ordered not to talk about the queen in commons
text: the commons speaker , and mp for buckingham , has ordered mps not to talk about the queen on the floor of the commons .
it follows suggestions in the sun newspaper that the queen wanted britain to leave the european union in the forthcoming referendum - a claim strenuously denied by buckingham palace .
`` we do n't discuss the views of the monarch in this chamber , '' john bercow said .
`` i think it 's best we leave it there . ''

documents.title: seven lambs killed in 'devastating ' dog attack
text: a savage dog attack which killed seven lambs at a farm in chalfont st giles last week could cost a farmer up to £ 1,000 and has led to calls for a change in the law .
author: Bucks Free Press

documents.title: weather watchers : school reporter 's photographs
text: as part of bbc school report 's 10th news day , pupils are not only getting involved in news reports but also reporting as weather watchers .
astley cooper school in hemel hempstead have shared a few photographs of a rather grey-looking highfield , including this one
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: counter terrorism strategy 'causing confusion '
text: confusion is being caused by the government 's counter terrorism strategy in schools , according to two of britiain 's unions representing teachers .
both the nut and unison say staff are not sure about exactly what to report to the authorities .
the department for education says it 's produced guidance on the prevent duty .
a luton mum told us how she refused to give her four-year-old son 's nursery permission to put him on a de-radicalisation programme after his drawings raised concerns .
hear the full report at 13:00 and 17:00 here .
author: BBC Radio's Asian Network

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : terror arrest in wycombe fatal collision charges
text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton mum 's shock at talks of referring boy , 4 , to prevent
text: the mother of a four-year-old from luton says she was shocked when staff at his nursery wanted to place him on a de-radicalisation programme because of some he 'd drawn .
the mother said staff told her a particular drawing `` of a man cutting a cucumber '' , was a problem : `` she said to me [ it 's ] a 'cooker bomb ' . ''
but the mum concluded it was due to the way her son said cucumber .
the boy was n't placed on a programme in the end .
hear the full report at 13:00 and 17:00 here .
author: BBC Radio's Asian Network

documents.title: woman , 92 , victim of attempted distraction burglary
text: a 92-year-old woman from milton keynes fell victim to an attempted distraction burglary on monday when a man knocked on her door and said he was from the water board .
described as white , 5ft 7ins and in his late 40s or 50s , he called at the home in crispin road , bradville , at about 19:00 , where he asked her to turn taps on and off repeatedly .
when the offender left , the woman found her cupboards upstairs were open .
police are reminding people to ask any cold callers for id .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bedfordshire floods : view from a rescue boat
text: this was the view from a fire service flood boat in the bedfordshire village of riseley yesterday .
dave sharples , a community first responder , was given a lift back by the crew after attending an emergency call .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: terror arrest in high wycombe
text: a 17-year-old boy has been arrested in high wycombe this morning on sus of terror offences .
the teenager was arrested on sus of arranging funds or property for the purposes of terrorism .
the south east counter terrorism unit made the arrest , which was pre-planned , alongside thames valley police , who say the investigation `` should have very little impact on residents '' .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingteenager arrested on terror offences
text: a 17-year-old has been arrested on sus of terror offences in high wycombe this morning .
more to follow shortly .

documents.title: child burnt in luton fire
text: a young child has been taken to hospital with burns after a house fire in luton yesterday afternoon which was caused by a hair dryer .
fire crews were called to telscombe way just before 14:30 to the fire in an upstairs bedroom .
the child suffered 20 % burns to its legs and face , but bedfordshire fire service say the mother was alerted by a smoke alarm fitted by them during an earlier safety check .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: local elections : registering to vote
text: it may be a couple of months until may , but if you want to vote in the forthcoming elections then you need to register by monday , 18 april to take part , the electoral commission says .
to register to vote you can visit the following website :
and , if you 're unsure as to whether you 're registered or not , or want to find out more about voting and taking part in the elections , then you can visit the voter information website here .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: police probe alleged 'crash for cash ' scam
text: a motorist believes he may have been a target in a `` crash for cash '' scam after filming a vehicle swerving towards his car and then braking suddenly .
audi driver stephen phillips captured the incident on his dashcam as he travelled towards berkhamsted on the a41 near bourne end on monday morning .
the footage shows a red car pull in front of mr phillips car and `` slam on his brakes '' .
hertfordshire police said it is investigating the incident .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dunstable school 'happy to discuss ' dinner debt with parents
text: a dunstable school has responded to reports it warned parents children would be given toast if they had n't paid for their children 's meals , saying pupils would be fed from the breakfast club or after-school menu instead .
the lancot lower school says its catering company is owed about £ 1,000 with some parents owing more than £ 100 .

stephen chamberlain , chief executive of the challenger multi academy trust , which runs the school , said it had told parents that if there 's a problem to come and talk to them and the trust would be `` more than happy to discuss different ways of resolving that problem '' .

documents.title: flood rescue in milton keynes
text: police in milton keynes say they 've already made one rescue from floods today .
they are warning motorists some rural roads are still under water .
some rural roads still flooded with no sign of lowering .
1 rescue today in newport , please do n't take risks !

documents.title: weather watchers : flood warnings continue
text: as the rain persists and flood warnings remain in place for parts of buckinghamshire and north bedfordshire , our weather watchers have been keeping us informed .
this is a photograph of the bedfordshire village of yelden , close to the border with northampton , yesterday evening .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: morning headlines : flood warnings dunstable school meal debts
text: the latest headlines :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: dorries calls for 'consultation ' over sunday trading laws
text: the mp for mid-bedfordshire , nadine dorries , has called for a `` full consultation '' over plans to relax sunday trading laws .
the government has abandoned proposals to give councils the power to allow large shops to open longer than the current six hour limit after being defeated in the commons yesterday .
twenty-seven conservative mps , including ms dorries , joining opposition parties to throw out the move .

she told the commons : `` if we really want to do this let 's put it in the queen 's speech , let 's have a public debate , let the public know about it properly and let 's have a full consultation . ''
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: flood warning issued for newport pagnell
text: a new flood warning has been put in place for newport pagnell , where levels are rising on the river great ouse and river ouzel , the environment agency has said .
flood warnings remain in place for the great ouse from buckingham into milton keynes and at riseley in north bedfordshire .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flood warnings remain in place in beds and bucks
text: flood warnings remain in place for the river great ouse from buckingham into milton keynes following yesterday 's heavy rain .
a warning also remains in place at riseley in north bedfordshire .
milton keynes council is urging motorists not to ignore `` road closed '' signs - but train services north of the new city are expected to return to normal this morning .
'road closed ' signs up across the mk area near roads which are unsafe to use - pls do not ignore them # floodaware
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : accident on m1
text: two lanes are blocked on the northbound m1 before j14 for the a509 at milton keynes due to an accident between a lorry and three cars .
congestion is currently back to j13 for the a421 at bedford .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watford fc sell more than 6,000 fa cup tickets in 24 hours
text: watford have sold more than 6,500 tickets for sunday 's fa cup quarter-final at arsenal in 24 hours .
the hornets have been allocated 9,000 tickets for the sixth round tie at the emirates stadium on sunday at 13:30 .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel : disruption on m1
text: one lane is blocked on the southbound m1 at j10 for luton airport due to a broken down cement lorry .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: school defends toast solution for school dinner debt
text: a school in dunstable has been defending its warning to give toast to children whose parents have n't paid for their meals .
as first reported in the dunstable gazette , some parents at lancot lower school are behind on payments .

the challenger multi academy trust , which runs the school , told bbc three counties radio its catering company is owed about £ 1,000 for meals taken by children , for which payment has yet to be made .
it said some parents owed in excess of £ 100 .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: today 's weather : murky start , brighter later
text: it will be a cloudy , but mostly dry day after any early rain clears .
there are due to be some sunny spells later .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: latest headlines : flood warnings in place for river great ouse school defends toast policy
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to the local live page for the three counties - we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , weather , travel and the best of social media .
apparently , 10 march is the designated day of awesomeness - i 'll do my best !
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can tweet us or email us here .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
